content: For the new Luau type solver, users can assign nil into tables with indexers.
Adds a Class.Players property named BanningEnabled, which enables/disables the three Class.Players methods that constitute the ban API.
Instance.Changed and DataModel.ItemChanged signals will no longer be called when non-scriptable of inaccessible properties change.
Fixes false positive error report in Luau typechecking when an unspecified enum is indexed with a string, for example, in Enum[a][b].

Adds the Class.TextChannel.DirectChatRequester property and TextChannel:SetDirectChatRequester(requestingPlayer) method, which developers can use to annotate TextChannels as "requested by" a particular player. TextChannels with a DirectChatRequester will automatically use CanUsersDirectChatAsync appropriately.
Fixes an issue when Class.EditableMesh doesn't get updated on some mobile devices.
Fixes pathfinding crash related to new improved algorithm.

You can now write scripts for PermissionPolicyFunction that change their return result to false while the Class.DragDetector is being dragged and will no longer crash when using the ModeSwitchKey to change between planar and linear translation. The permission policy now only checks on mouse down, and that answer will be used until mouse up, even if the ModeSwitchKey is pressed.
Fixes Class.GroundController sliding when landing on slopes.
Fixes a Luau parser bug that could cause Luau to hang indefinitely when parsing ill-formed table types in class declarations.
Fixes an issue that could prevent tools from being equipped in some scenarios, such as when ImprovedModelStreaming is enabled.
Fixes certain "EditableImage/EditableMesh is not accessible" errors in the command line or plugins in Studio
Opening a place with terrain panel docked now selects the Select Dragger by default instead of attempting to select one of the terrain tools by default.
